subject: Congrats, Congrats
event: Congratulations to GILLIAN FLYNN.  Her story "What Do You Do?" from ROGUES has been nominated for an Edgar Award by the members of the Mystery Writers of America. It's a terrific story, and Gillian is an amazing writer.  Gardner Dozois and I are very proud to have had the honor of publishing it. Fingers crossed for Gillian to bring home the head of Edgar Allan Poe when the MWA gives them out at the end of April. For a full list of this year's Edgar nominees, go to http://www.theedgars.com/nominees.html If you'd like to read "What Do You Do?" -- and a lot of other great stories about con men, scalawags, ne'er do wells, cads, scoundrels, and their disreputable brothers and sisters -- ROGUES is available from your local bookstore or favorite online bookseller.  And you can snag a signed copy (signed by me, not Gillian, alas) from the Jean Cocteau Cinema at http://www.jeancocteaubooks.com/ Congratulations also to the amazing and talented SOPHIE TURNER, our very own Sansa Stark, who has just landed the plum role of Jean Grey in the next X-MEN movie. Yes, THAT Jean Grey.  Marvel Girl.  Phoenix.  Dark Phoenix.  One of the most iconic.. and most powerful... characters in the Marvel universe. I first met Jean Grey in the first issue of the X-MEN, when Stan Lee and Jack Kirby introduced them back in the 1960s.  I first met Sophie when when we were shooting the pilot of GAME OF THRONES.  This is a casting made in comic book heaven.  It brings out the old fanboy in me, the kid who used to write letters that began "Dear Stan and Jack."  Sophie will be terrific. 'Nuff said.

props.taglist: movies, films, anthologies, awards, game of thrones

comments.article: Since he is known for his affiliation to the Santa Fe Institute I wondered if you two ever interact at all?
comments.subject: Cormac McCarthy

comments.article:
Sophie Turner broke out in a show where everybody dies, Jean Grey seems to die once every few years, fits nicely imo.

Awesome to hear that Gillian's story is nominated for an award. She's an amazing writer and has such an awesome voice in the mystery field.
Gillian Flynn is indeed amazing, Gone Girl is a favorite of mine. Her character Amy Dunne in Gone Girl reminds me of Cersei Lannister quite a lot.
Amy Dunne has the scheming tendencies of Cersei, but also has the brilliance of Tyrion.
Miss Turner is becoming quite a stunner heherself!
Big congratulations to both... and of course to you, sir, for producing opportunities where people can succeed with you.
comments.subject: Two great things in one

comments.article:
I'm curious to see how well she pulls off an American accent.

Unless they rewrite Jean Grey as being from England.

I'm sure she would have had to satisfy the producers of her ability to manage an American accent before her casting was announced, as many British actors have done in the past, whatever Tina Fey and Amy Poehler might think of their delivery.

Incidentally, Sophie is from Northampton, the home of Alan Moore. Thankfully she neither sounds like, nor - gods be praised - remotely resembles him.
comments.subject: Accent

comments.article:
I'm so very excited she was cast in the role. When I first heard rumors of it as a possibility, I didn't want to get my hopes up. Because of how Jean Grey had been portrayed in the movies, I have never been a fan of her.

Since I am a fan of Sophie, I have high expectations for Age of Apocalypse.
Sophie Turner is so hot!

Hello! Your entry got to top-25 of the most popular entries in LiveJournal!
Learn more about LiveJournal Ratings in FAQ.
I'm so excited for Sophie! She's such a talented actress. I love her as Sansa and she will surely be an amazing Jean Grey.

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: pic#124268277
comments.article: That was the first time I'd read anything by Gillian Flynn.  Her story was a total mind-fuck.  And that is one of the highest compliments I can give.  She's drawing me out of my fantasy-genre comfort zone.  (Don't worry, though, I have enough love for all the books.)
So excited for Sophie!

Great news for Ms. Turner! But I'll reserve my amazement until they cast you as Thanos.

- Jared

Great news all around!!

Sophie Turner as Jean Grey is awesome news, indeed!!:D Jean Grey and the Dark Phoenix Saga is what started me reading X-Men when I was in my teens-the story had just got published here, a few years late, but we had no idea back then!;) One of my favorite characters and Sophie will be AMAZING!!!
I am reading GIllian Flynn right now Gone Girl really good book (have to admit saw the movie first). Then onto reading Joe Abercrombie's Half A King heard good things.
comments.subject: GIllian Flynn

comments.article: I just want to say, I think it's really cool that you take the time to acknowledge the excellent work of your peers. It's interesting to hear what impresses you, plus it shows that you're still humble despite all the success. I wish more creators told us what work they admired!
Sadly I think I'm gonna have to avoid seeing X-Men Apocalypse - Sophie Turner in a superhero costume is too much for my blood vessels to withstand.
Hahaha "bring home the head of Edgar Allen Poe", that's hilarious, keep it in a glass jar! Lol
Sophie is gonna be an amazing Jean Grey! :D

Oh wow, George R R Martin wrote letters to the X-Men Letter Section??

I'm actually reading the original X-Men comics atm (issue 14 or 15 at the moment, the first introduction of the Sentinels!) and I often read the Letter Section just to get a feeling about youngsters from the 60ies!

Any chance one of your letters got printed? And if so which issue?

I also love the idea of Sophie als Jean! Looking forward to that movie!!
comments.subject: Letter Section

comments.article: Perchance Sophie Turner would also enjoy playing Peregrine or Chrysalis.  I can see her fitting into the Wild Cards universe well, particularly Wild Cards V.  Naturally, eXpectations always run high, of course, but I know she would be the perfect person for the role.  Please accept my adoration for your wonderful Wild Cards series and as always, Great Ser, I look forward to more installments of Wild Cards.
comments.subject: Sophie Tuner can do no wrong.

comments.article: I'd like to add my congratulation to Sophie (and the other lady) though my comment is largely gratuitous, as I mainly wanted to look at the picture again. Do you have any more?
comments.subject: Just wondering...

comments.article: I tried to put this in one of your wolf posts.  But I thought you would be interested in this video from the maker of the Honey Badger video.  But now he does wolves.  http://youtu.be/LKeBIMgACxU
Why does it say original stories by those people and edited by you? Isn't this book about the Targaryen dynasty. So why would it be written by anyone except you?
comments.subject: Rogue!

comments.article: No, the book is about rogues.  Only my own story concerns the Targaryens.
comments.subject: Re: Rogue!

comments.article:
Sir i am one of your biggest fans i am from Egypt and i would like to invite you to my wedding which will be on the 30th of April in Cairo, Egypt. I know it is a long shot and i dont want to distract you from finishing winds of winter :) but i am honored to invite you.

If you can come please e-mail me at B_Hammet@hotmail.com so i can arrangeeverything for you.
comments.subject: Wedding invitation
